intro: Phlegmariurus chamaeleon, commonly known as the green clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with upright, branching stems covered in tiny, scale-like leaves. It reproduces via spores rather than seeds, releasing them from specialized structures called sporangia. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of certain ecosystems.
